main event: Several witnesses in Craig, Colorado observed a string of lights moving at high speed across the sky in the early morning hours of September 26, 1956.
interesting points: The object was described as a string of approximately 10 lights, preceded by 3-4 smaller and brighter lights slightly ahead of the main group.
The object moved at a speed of around 85-100 mph and passed directly over Craig, estimated to be 1-2 thousand feet above the ground.
A bright flashing light, similar to an airplane beacon, was observed on the object as it passed.
There was no sound associated with the object, indicating it was not a conventional aircraft.
Three other witnesses corroborated the sighting, which lasted around 10 minutes.
sighted object: a string of lights, approximately 10, preceded by 3-4 smaller and brighter lights
witnesses: 4 civilian witnesses, including Mr. and Mrs. [REDACTED]
